turns.text: Why dont you tell me about your choir
turns.label: ad

turns.text: Oh Okay well we uh are group of uh musicians that just kind of have you know formed out of desire to sing and many of the people in the group are very professional in the sense that they or just real talented I should say
turns.label: b

turns.text: Lot of them are former music teachers or currently teaching Uh others have - theres one gal thats in the uh Plano Community Orchestra Uh just you know different backgrounds Its been really kind of interesting
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- and uh I have four year old who who has started to play the piano He does that uh musically listens and then he can play which is kind of interesting
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I think its because hes always heard music in our home all the since he was baby
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Uh my husband and my other son whos eleven just got through singing in musical here in in the community at Music Man
turns.label: sd

turns.text: How did they get involved in that
Uh basically they read in the newspaper that there were open auditions It was the Plano Repertory Theatre
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And so they went and tried out and my husband played Harold Hill from the Music Man and my son played one of the children in band
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So yeah it was really fun and uh my son plays the clarinet in his band at school and my daughter takes piano lessons too
turns.label: aa

turns.text: But uh we just really like music Its I I especially like it as an outlet when the goes off we --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- get the off and just have some nice quiet music
Yeah yeah thats nice You say have your four year old taking lessons already
turns.label: b

turns.text: And uh who do you have her or him take it from
turns.label: qw

turns.text: Uh I have him take from friend of mine who teaches Suzuki
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Which is an auditory type learning experience You listen to the music and then learn to play it by lear- by hearing the intervals and things like that

I teach uh like what is traditionally taught you know you look at the note on the page and you play whats on the piano but he cant learn like that Hes delayed child Hes only about I guess hes about two and half in his real understanding of things
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh so when my friend played something on the piano and he played it uh with his right hand we went wow --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- we better have him do - do something
turns.label: ^q

turns.text: My husband and I love to go to the musicals downtown though
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So my husband and I love to go to the musicals when they come into town --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh Well I have an eight and half year old daughter whos taking piano lessons and started out at the age of just turning five --
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- because she wanted you know she just seemed to enjoy it so much and now my my four year old four and half year old daughter is is trying to imitate her older sister and wanting to play and she actually does some very nice chording just naturally She just -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: So I wasnt sure when to start her I didnt want to push her too early either but uh kind of had mixed feelings about that scene
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Thats really hard I think because especially if you start them and then they get pretty good and then they get close ten you know eleven or something they go I dont want to do this anymore and youre like --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- God I really want you to do it
So sometimes its hard to to know exactly when but I dont know if she acts like she wants to or says she wants to maybe you could have her take some for while and see how she likes it
turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh uh-huh Yeah I think shed like to I just dont know if its really - knowing from what my daughter has gone through shes she learned lot and of course it was something she had to keep relearning if she ever got away from it
turns.label: aa

turns.text: It was something easily forgotten So uh I dont know if shes any farther ahead than those kids who started when they were eight or or should I say seven I mean shes not gifted pianist in the sense that shes going to excel just naturally She does have to really work at it but uh so -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah but so Im kind of you know just playing with it but at this point were going to kind of wait I think just more for the financial reasons of it anyway but -
turns.label: b

turns.text: I my friend is is very generous in in letting us have my children uh do the Suzuki method --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah so its been good for our family
